text.p: Dominion Bond Rating Service said on Wednesday it confirmed the ratings of Dofasco Inc's commercial paper at R-1 (low) with a stable trend, and senior debts at BBB (high) and class A preferred shares, series A, at Pfd-3, both with a positive trend.
Dofasco said on Monday it will redeem all outstanding class C preferred shares on June 4 at their par values of C$32.50 per share plus accrued dividends of C$0.46 per share.
DBRS said the announcement was not unexpected and the totoal share repurchase cost will be about C$322.6 million, to be funded with cash on hand.

The bond rating service said the effect of the repurchase will be a weaker balance sheet, with net debt increasing to 33 percent of total capitalization (on a proforma basis) from 20 percent at the end of the first quarter.
The fixed charge coverage ratio will improve, however, due to the significant reduction in preferred dividends, DBRS said.
It said the balance sheet is still respectable, despite the higher leverage.
Market conditions are expected to remain positive in 1997 and earnings and operating cash flow should remain stable.
In addition, with the completion of the electric arc furnace and slab caster projects, capital expenditures are expected to decline to C$160 million, about 50 percent of 1996 levels, DBRS said.
It said higher cash flow, helped by stable operating cash flow and lower capital expenditures should help strengthen the balance sheet through 1997.
